intro: Liebigia bracteosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or bracteosa morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of morning glories. Its structure features a climbing habit with tendrils that help it ascend supports. Botanically, it is notable for its complex floral morphology and adaptability to various soil types.
